item.title: U.S. Dollar's Strength to Endure, Dominance Isn't at Risk, Says Morgan Stanley
item.description: Morgan Stanley Research expects the dollar’s resilience to endure, building on gains versus the euro and the Chinese yuan in the short term due to the U.S. business cycle.

item.title: China Reports Steady Youth Unemployment
item.description: China’s youth unemployment rate remained steady in March, in what could be seen by some as a tentative sign that the world’s second-largest economy is gradually stabilizing.

item.title: ABB Earnings Rise, Orders Fall
item.description: ABB reported an 11% rise in first-quarter underlying earnings despite a drop in orders.

item.title: TSMC Profit Rises on Demand for Advanced Chips
item.description: The results follow three straight quarterly declines and benefit from a global boom in artificial intelligence.

item.title: EasyJet Sees Narrower Loss as Travel Demand Builds
item.description: EasyJet expects to report a headline pretax loss of roughly $423 million-$448 million in the first half, with demand for summer bookings continuing to build.

item.title: Bond Markets Seen Offering Opportunities Even Amid Tighter Spreads
item.description: There are opportunities in bond markets despite tighter spreads, Edmond de Rothschild Asset Management said, adding that with rates high in absolute terms, they offer some protection against any economic accident.

item.title: EU Car Sales Record Biggest Drop in 16 Months
item.description: Registrations of new cars in the European Union fell 5.2% on year in March, the largest monthly drop since November 2022, and in line with a trend of softening demand.

item.title: Nokia Expects Demand in Mobile Networks to Pick Up
item.description: Nokia posted first-quarter earnings that beat expectations and said the period marked the low point in mobile networks demand, with activity expected to progressively pick up through the remainder of 2024.

item.title: Danone Backs Outlook as Sales, Volumes Beat Estimates
item.description: Danone said it expected like-for-like sales growth of between 3% and 5% in 2024, and confirmed it anticipated a moderate improvement in recurring operating margin.

item.title: Apple to Spend More Than $250 Million to Expand Singapore Hub
item.description: Apple will invest more than $250 million to expand a regional hub in Singapore to support growth and new undertakings in artificial intelligence, as the U.S. tech giant seeks to diversify its footprint in Asia and cut exposure to China.

item.title: TikTok Ban Measure Attached to House Foreign Aid Bill, Boosting Odds of Passage
item.description: The legislation would extend the sale period for the popular Chinese-controlled app in the U.S. to seek new owners.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.3%, Led by Financial, Chip-Related Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in financial and chip-related stocks, as some bargain-hunting kicks in following three consecutive sessions of losses.

item.title: Is Apple an Illegal Monopoly? Antitrust Lawyer Breaks Down U.S. v. Apple
item.description: The Department of Justice is claiming that Apple is an illegal monopoly, hanging its case on a century-old law called the Sherman Act. WSJ breaks down the DOJ’s legal argument, and how Apple might fight back.

item.title: Google Fires 28 Employees for Protesting Company's Cloud Deal With Israel
item.description: A joint contract with Amazon has drawn the ire of tech workers.

item.title: China Pledges to Steady Yuan as Asian Currencies Come Under Pressure
item.description: China’s central bank reiterated its commitment to a stable yuan, joining the chorus of Asian officials concerned about weakening regional currencies.

item.title: Maui's 2023 Lahaina Fire can be traced back to a brush fire ignited by a broken power line, a report by Hawaii's attorney general said.
item.description: Maui’s 2023 Lahaina Fire can be traced back to a brush fire ignited by a broken power line, a report by Hawaii’s attorney general said.

item.title: Columbia's president faced pointed questions from members of a congressional panel critical of the university's response to instances of antisemitism on campus.
item.description: Columbia’s president faced pointed questions from members of a congressional panel critical of the university’s response to instances of antisemitism on campus.

item.title: House Speaker Johnson said he would proceed with a high-stakes vote to move long-stalled funding for Ukraine, Israel and other overseas allies, elbowing aside criticism from his conservative flank.
item.description: House Speaker Johnson said he would proceed with a high-stakes vote to move long-stalled funding for Ukraine, Israel and other overseas allies, elbowing aside criticism from his conservative flank.

item.title: Republicans in the Arizona state House blocked two attempts to repeal the state's 160-year-old near total ban on abortion.
item.description: Republicans in the Arizona state House blocked two attempts to repeal the state’s 160-year-old near total ban on abortion.

item.title: The Justice Department agreed to pay about $100 million to victims of former national women's gymnastics team doctor Larry Nassar, acknowledging FBI failures.
item.description: The Justice Department agreed to pay about $100 million to victims of former national women’s gymnastics team doctor Larry Nassar, acknowledging FBI failures.
